description: From hopeful +‎ -ly. The use as a sentence adverb first gained currency in the United States and has been explained as a possible calque of German hoffentlich.

adverbs.description: hopefully (comparative more hopefully, superlative most hopefully)

examples: ‘In fifteen minutes I will be at the carpark, sitting hopefully inside a puce Reliant Scimitar.’

entries.meaning: (not comparable) It is hoped that; I hope; we hope. [from 18th c.]
examples: Hopefully, my father will arrive in time for the show.
She was buried with her mom and hopefully they are together now.
